Title: Kyle Anderson Exits Sunday's Game With Back Spasms
Content: Minnesota Timberwolves forward Kyle Anderson (back) was forced to exit the team's Sunday night contest against the Denver Nuggets due to back spasms. He was already listed as questionable heading into the game and was only able to get on the court for 13 minutes before the spasms flared up. Matt Ryan and Taurean Prince will see more opportunities while Anderson is out, and fantasy managers should monitor Anderson's status heading into this coming week to decide on streaming options.

Title: Kyle Kuzma Sprains Ankle On Saturday
Content: Washington Wizards forward Kyle Kuzma (ankle) was injured during Saturday's loss to the Brooklyn Nets. The 27-year-old tweaked his left ankle in the second quarter and didn't return, ending his night after only 11 minutes of work. Kuzma has played well this season, averaging a career-high 21.6 points along with 7.7 rebounds and 4.0 assists. With the Wizards hosting the Cavaliers on Monday, there's a chance he won't be on the floor. If that's the case, Deni Avdija, who's averaged 8.7 points, 6.2 rebounds, and 2.9 assists in 30 starts this season, is the favorite to take Kuzma's spot in the starting lineup if he doesn't suit up.

Title: Dario Saric Starting On Friday Night
Content: Phoenix Suns forward Dario Saric will start on Friday against the Boston Celtics. Cameron Johnson (knee) will get the night off on the front end of a back-to-back before likely returning on Saturday versus Detroit. Saric has averaged 8.5 points, 4.2 rebounds and shot 47.1% in 11 starts this season, so there is certainly something there for fantasy managers in deeper formats. However, he'll likely split time with Torrey Craig, who should also be productive with Johnson out of the lineup.

Title: Jalen Brunson Ruled Out For Thursday
Content: New York Knicks guard Jalen Brunson (illness) has been ruled out for Thursday's game against the Miami Heat. The 26-year-old will sit this game out due to a non-COVID related illness. Immanuel Quickley is likely the next man up, so he should start at point guard on Thursday. He'll be a strong streaming option, while Miles McBride gets more minutes as well. However, McBride is more of a deep league option.

Title: Trae Young Available On Wednesday
Content: Atlanta Hawks guard Trae Young (ankle) has been upgraded to available for Wednesday's game against the Phoenix Suns. The star guard is back after missing Monday's contest due to right ankle soreness. His return means that Aaron Holiday will shift to the bench on Wednesday night. He played 15 minutes on Monday, so Holiday wasn't offering much fantasy value anyway. Fantasy managers should make sure they have Young in their lineups for Wednesday.

Title: Jamal Murray Set To Play Tuesday Night
Content: Denver Nuggets guard Jamal Murray (knee) is available to play Tuesday night against the New Orleans Pelicans. Murray was listed as questionable for injury management with his knee, but he will play, as expected. The Nuggets are not in the middle of a back-to-back set, but Murray did play 39 minutes on Saturday and Denver is likely being cautious with his workload. Whenever Murray does see a rest day, Bruce Brown and Bones Hyland will likely see increased minutes.

Title: T.J. Warren To Miss Monday's Game
Content: Brooklyn Nets forward T.J. Warren (shin) has been ruled out for Monday's game against the Los Angeles Lakers. He'll join fellow forward Ben Simmons (knee) on the sideline for the second straight game. The Nets will likely use a committee approach to help fill the void left by their two injured forwards. That being said, Yuta Watanabe, Royce O'Neale, and Joe Harris will all see increased roles. Harris is the best streaming out of the trio, so fantasy managers should check to see if he's available for Monday.

Title: Trae Young Questionable Against Portland On Monday
Content: Atlanta Hawks guard Trae Young (ankle) has been tagged as questionable for Monday's contest against the Portland Trail Blazers. The 24-year-old has been on the injury report a handful of times for his ankle and he's played through it a few times before. So far, Young has only missed five games this season. If he can't suit up, however, Dejounte Murray should see a lot more usage as the lead guard, and Aaron Holiday and Bogdan Bogdanovic could serve as streaming options for a fantasy team in need.

Title: Myles Turner Signs Extension With Pacers
Content: Indiana Pacers center Myles Turner has agreed to an extension with the organization. This is an interesting development given the trade rumors surrounding Turner. The big man gets a two-year deal worth $60 million. This doesn't mean Turner can't be traded, but the likelihood does decrease. Turner has been playing at a high level this season as the Pacers are surprisingly in the playoff race. This extension isn't great news for the fantasy value of Isaiah Jackson. Although, Turner could still be moved at the deadline, so it might not be time to give up on Turner yet.

Title: Kentavious Caldwell-Pope, Bruce Brown Good To Go
Content: Denver Nuggets guard/forward Kentavious Caldwell-Pope (wrist) and guard/forward Bruce Brown (knee) will be in the lineup Saturday against the 76ers. The latter has shaken off a questionable tag, while Caldwell-Pope returns to action from a one-game absence. The former Laker has quietly had a very solid season in the Nuggets starting unit, averaging 11.4 points, 2.9 rebounds, 2.2 assists and 1.3 steals. Brown has also started the last three games and will head back to the bench on Saturday, but he's been very productive as a reserve as well and remains a vital piece for the team.
